articles.markdown_data:
# My Top 10 Video Games of All Time

> *A curated list of the games that shaped my taste, each one memorable for its own unique identity.*

---

## 1. **Final Fantasy VIII**

![Final Fantasy VIII](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1s5r.jpg)

**Final Fantasy VIII** stands out for its *emotion‑driven narrative*, its stylish world, and the iconic **Junction System**, which lets you customize characters in deep and unusual ways.  
The blend of realism, romance, and cinematic storytelling makes it one of the most distinctive entries in the series.

---

## 2. **Metal Gear Solid**

![Metal Gear Solid](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1wyy.jpg)

A groundbreaking mix of **stealth**, *cinematic direction*, and fourth‑wall‑breaking creativity.  
Metal Gear Solid redefined what video game storytelling could be, with unforgettable boss encounters like **Psycho Mantis** and a political thriller tone that still feels bold today.

---

## 3. **The Witcher**

![The Witcher](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co20n0.jpg)

*Dark fantasy, moral ambiguity, and meaningful consequences.*  
The Witcher’s world is gritty and mature, where choices rarely feel clean or heroic. Geralt’s role as a professional monster hunter gives the game a tone unlike any other RPG.

---

## 4. **The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion**

![The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1yvt.jpg)

Oblivion delivers a sense of **freedom** that few games match.  
You can explore, role‑play, join guilds, or wander Cyrodiil at your own pace. Its Daedric quests and the surreal *Shivering Isles* expansion give it a wonderfully strange personality.

---

## 5. **Mass Effect**

![Mass Effect](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1x3t.jpg)

A blend of **sci‑fi world‑building**, *RPG depth*, and cinematic storytelling.  
Your choices shape Commander Shepard’s personality and relationships, making the journey feel personal. The universe — its alien cultures, politics, and lore — feels fully alive.

---

## 6. **Shenmue**

![Shenmue](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co2a6k.jpg)

Shenmue pioneered the idea of a **living world** long before it was common.  
NPC schedules, mini‑games, weather systems, and slice‑of‑life moments give it a grounded, almost meditative feel. It’s a slow, deliberate adventure with a unique charm.

---

## 7. **Yakuza 0**

![Yakuza 0](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1xw1.jpg)

A perfect mix of **serious crime drama** and *absurd humor*.  
One moment you’re in a tense emotional scene, and the next you’re singing karaoke or running a cabaret club. Its combat, characters, and 1980s Japan setting give it unmatched personality.

---

## 8. **Red Dead Redemption**

![Red Dead Redemption](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1wyy.jpg)

A powerful story about the **end of the Wild West**.  
The world feels alive with dynamic events, atmospheric music, and a strong sense of place. John Marston’s journey — filled with themes of loyalty, change, and redemption — is unforgettable.

---

## 9. **Uncharted: Drake’s Fortune**

![Uncharted: Drake's Fortune](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co1x5d.jpg)

A playable **action‑adventure movie**.  
With cinematic set pieces, witty character banter, and pulpy treasure‑hunting energy, it set the tone for the entire Uncharted series. Nate, Elena, and Sully’s chemistry is the heart of the experience.

---

## 10. **Xenoblade Chronicles 2**

![Xenoblade Chronicles 2](https://images.igdb.com/igdb/image/upload/t_cover_big/co2fpe.jpg)

A massive world built on the backs of **living titans**.  
Its anime‑inspired storytelling, emotional character arcs, and the deep **Blade system** make combat and exploration feel epic. The soundtrack and world‑building elevate the entire journey.

---

authors.biography: I’m a front-end developer who loves teaching others how to code. My tutorials will be focusing mostly on entry level web applications. If you're a recent college grad or someone interested in the profession. I will be going over things that you will need to know to get into the market. What is expected and most likely what you didn’t learn in college. Most of my articles will eventually have a video that goes along with the topic in the near future. When I’m not coding, you can find me enjoying a glass of green tea with jasmine, the perfect blend. My favorite gaming genre is JRPGs. Currently in the process of developing my own video games. Follow me here as I post updates regarding the game I’m currently working on. Along with coding tutorials for beginners.

A seeker of wisdom from ages past, tracing footsteps of ancient civilizations across the globe. From ancient structures to the myths of Norse. Finding parallels between long-gone societies and the tenets of modern religion, suggesting many truths hidden in text. Uncovering secrets found in the unknown realm. Taking time to enjoy life and debate with friends. A connoisseur of coffee and wine. Someone who enjoys playing retro games and discovering the tricks the developers used to make them. You can find me here with my latest work and things I’m currently interested in.
